title: Corrupt database contents - panic on invalid number of list elements
body:
#### System information

Geth version:1.9.24-stable
Git Commit: cc05b050df5f88e80bb26aaf6d2f339c49c2d702
Architecture: amd64
Ubuntu 20.04 on odroid h2+, nvme samsung 970 evo 1To , 32Go RAM, fiber internet connection

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour
command : `/usr/bin/geth  --http --datadir /var/lib/goethereum/mainnet --metrics --pprof`
Sync a geth node on mainnet with ubuntu 20.04 is ok then I can't keep my node in sync for more than 1 day without this kind of error (I tried 5 times from scratch)

#### Backtrace


This indicates that there's a corruption in the database, where a certain node is not missing, but corrupt. It would theoretically be possible to repair this if the keccak preimage of `3043af6367c2cb070164cdf3e70f20c886b259da33ba3c41463c0619ee0cb052` was inserted, but it's not something which we can easily fix. 

In order to fix it, one would have to open the leveldb database of a non-corrupt node, and do a `db.Get(...)` on the key, and then insert it into your leveldb. Would also be interesting to see what exactly is stored there. 

I'll code up a PoC for this, so we can investigate what has happened here.

Please try out https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/pull/21991 . Build it, then run 

```
geth --datadir /var/lib/goethereum/mainnet db.get 0x3043af6367c2cb070164cdf3e70f20c886b259da33ba3c41463c0619ee0cb052
```

Note, though: although it seems possible to fix this particular error, and I'm highly curious what your database has there instead of the true content, I also believe that the root issue might be that your SSD is flaky, and has some corrupt portion.
